meanings.definition: To make or stain black like ebony.
meanings.sent1: She ebonised the old chair to give it a sleek, modern look.
meanings.sent2: The craftsman ebonised the wooden frame to match the rest of the furniture.
meanings.sent3: After ebonising the table, it looked like a mysterious treasure in the room.
meanings.sent4: The artist ebonised the canvas with bold strokes, creating a striking contrast.
meanings.sent5: The ebonised finish on the door made it stand out elegantly in the hallway.

meanings.definition: Made or stained black like ebony.
meanings.sent1: The ebonised cabinet added a touch of sophistication to the room.
meanings.sent2: She admired the ebonised jewelry box for its elegant design.
meanings.sent3: The ebonised piano keys gleamed under the stage lights.
meanings.sent4: The ebonised frame of the mirror reflected a sense of timeless beauty.
meanings.sent5: The ebonised bookshelf blended seamlessly with the dark decor of the study.
